intro: Eriogonum dumosum, commonly known as sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its low-growing, shrub-like form with dense, gray-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple, typically blooming in the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Eriogonum dumosum is an important plant for pollinators and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
